title: Session Plan
description: Fundamentals warm-up, voicing drills and tune study queue inspired by the practice notes.

exercises.label: Melodic Minor Scale (C, F, Bb)
exercises.notes: Play the full range ascending and descending. Focus on even tone while bringing out guide tones at the top of each arpeggio.

exercises.label: Diatonic Triads
exercises.notes: Cycle triads through all keys: root position, then first and second inversion. Keep the metronome on 2 & 4 and accent beat 1 lightly.

exercises.label: Bud Powell Voicings Exercise 1
exercises.notes: Shell voicings in the Bud Powell style. Lock in with the MIDI guide and keep the 3rd/7th voice leading smooth.

exercises.label: Type A/B Major II-V-I (One Handed)
exercises.notes: Play along with the Rhodes comping. Aim for legato top notes while keeping the lower voices punchy.

exercises.label: Blues for Alice – 2-Feel Bassline with Head
exercises.notes: Walk the bass under the head melody; prioritise clear quarter notes. Use the MIDI guide to check voice leading in the turnaround.

exercises.label: Blues for Alice – 2-Feel Bassline with Chords
exercises.notes: Add shell chords on beats 2 & 4 over the walking bass. Keep the comping light and dance on the upbeat.

exercises.label: Blues for Alice – Left Hand Shuttle
exercises.notes: Practice the left-hand guide-tone shuttle without MIDI so you can focus on touch and dynamics.

exercises.label: Autumn Leaves – 2-Feel Bassline with Head (G min)
exercises.notes: Outline the melody in the right hand while keeping a relaxed two-beat feel. Listen for how the MIDI track phrases the guide tones.

exercises.label: Autumn Leaves – 2-Feel Bassline with Chords
exercises.notes: Comp lightly above the bassline. Aim for smooth inner-voice motion and clean releases.

exercises.label: Autumn Leaves – Left Hand Shuttle
exercises.notes: Lock the shuttle pattern with the accompaniment track, then drop the MIDI and keep the click only once it feels solid.
